summary: Orlando Bosch was a Cuban exile leader involved in anti-Castro activities. The documents reveal his activities in Venezuela, including being under the protection of Venezuelan President Carlos Andres Perez in 1976. He was involved in the bombing of a Cuban airliner. He was also associated with other Cuban exiles and organizations, including Rolando Otero Hernandez and CORU. The documents also mention his deteriorating health during a hunger strike and fears of exile reprisals. He was also connected to JMWAVE activities. Chilean government information indicates Bosch used false Chilean identity documents. The documents span from the 1960s to the late 1970s, showing a sustained period of involvement in anti-Castro activities.
significance: The Latin America Division (LAD) report, dated June 29, 1977, summarizes a task force investigation into possible Cuban complicity in the John F. Kennedy assassination, reviewing Agency operations against Cuba from 1960 to 1965 and finding no definitive proof of Cuban involvement.
